contentrichtext.text: <noinclude>{{../doc}} {{Divhide|Staging area}} ==Images== Use only ONE image at a time <gallery> File:Orson Welles 1937.jpg|Orson Welles in 1937 Image:WorldColumbian.JPG|World Columbian Exposition, Chicago, 1893 File:Overture low.ogg|The Marriage of Figaro Overture (use {{tl|DYK Listen}}) File:Manhattan at Dusk by slonecker.jpg|Empire State Building File:Carol Ann Duffy (cropped).jpg|Carol Ann Duffy File:Carolus Linnaeus (cleaned up version).jpg|Carl Linnaeus </gallery> ==Ineligible== {|class="wikitable" |- !Blurb !Reason |- | '''[[May Day]]''' | refimprove |- |[[1893]] – The '''[[World's Columbian Exposition]]''', a [[Expo (exhibition)|World's Fair]] to celebrate the 400th anniversary of [[Christopher Columbus]]' discovery of the New World, opened in [[Chicago]]. |refimprove section |- | [[1931]] – [[New York City]]'s '''[[Empire State Building]]''', at the time the [[List of tallest buildings and structures in the world|tallest building in the world]], opened. | convert list to prose |- | [[1941]] – '''''[[Citizen Kane]]''''', a [[List of films considered the best|widely acclaimed film]] by actor and director [[Orson Welles]], premiered. | section too detailed |- |[[1960]] – [[Bombay State]] in India was partitioned into '''[[Gujarat]]''' and '''[[Maharashtra]]''' along [[Languages of India|linguistic lines]]. |Gujarat has unreferenced section |} ==Eligible== {{*mp}} [[880]] – The '''[[Nea Ekklesia]]''' church in [[Constantinople]] was consecrated, and would go on to set the model for all later [[cross-in-square]] [[Eastern Orthodox Church|Orthodox]] churches. {{*mp}} [[1707]] – Under the terms of the [[Acts of Union 1707|Acts of Union]]<!--Not bolded, tagged with {{refimprove}}-->, the Kingdoms of England and Scotland merged to form the '''[[Kingdom of Great Britain]]''', a single kingdom encompassing the entire island of [[Great Britain]] with a [[Parliament of Great Britain|single parliament]] and government based in [[Westminster]]. {{*mp}} [[1753]] – '''[[Carl Linnaeus]]''' published his ''[[Species Plantarum]]''<!--not bolded, stubby-->, which, with his earlier work ''[[Systema Naturae]]'', is considered the beginning of modern [[botanical nomenclature]]. {{*mp}} [[1786]] – '''''[[The Marriage of Figaro]]''''', an [[opera buffa]] composed by [[Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart]], premiered at the [[Burgtheater]] in [[Vienna]]. {{*mp}} [[1794]] – [[War of the Pyrenees]]: France regained nearly all the land it lost to Spain the previous year with its victory in the '''[[Battle of Boulou]]'''. {{*mp}} [[1865]] – Brazil, Uruguay and Argentina signed '''[[Treaty of the Triple Alliance|a treaty]]''' creating an alliance against Paraguay in the [[War of the Triple Alliance]]. {{*mp}} [[1885]] – The original '''[[Chicago Board of Trade Building]]''' opened for business. {{*mp}} [[1898]] – The American [[Asiatic Squadron]] under [[Commodore (USN)|Commodore]] [[George Dewey]] defeated the Spanish Pacific Squadron under Admiral [[Patricio Montojo]] at the '''[[Battle of Manila Bay]]''', the first engagement of the [[Spanish–American War]]. {{*mp}} [[2009]] – '''[[Carol Ann Duffy]]''' was appointed [[Poet Laureate of the United Kingdom]], the first woman, the first Scot, and the first openly [[Bisexuality|bisexual]] person to hold the position, as well as the first laureate to be chosen in the 21st century. </ul> ==Notes== {{*mp}} [[Woolworth Building]] appears on [[Wikipedia:Selected anniversaries/April 24|April 24]], so Empire State Building should not appear in the same year {{divhide|end}} </noinclude> '''[[May 1]]''': '''[[International Workers' Day]]'''; '''[[Beltane]]''' in Ireland and Scotland; '''[[Law Day, U.S.A.|Law Day]]''' and '''[[Loyalty Day]]''' in the United States <div style="float:right;margin-left:0.5em"> [[Image:Penny black.jpg|Penny Black postage stamp|100x100px]] </div> {{*mp}} [[1776]] – The '''[[Illuminati|Order of the Illuminati]]''', a [[secret society]], was founded by [[Adam Weishaupt]] and [[Adolph von Knigge]] in [[Ingolstadt]], [[Bavaria]], Germany. {{*mp}} [[1840]] – The United Kingdom issued the '''[[Penny Black]]''' ''(pictured)'', the world's first official adhesive [[postage stamp]]. {{*mp}} [[1851]] – '''[[The Great Exhibition]]''', the first ever [[world's fair]], opened in [[London]]'s [[Hyde Park, London|Hyde Park]]. {{*mp}} [[1897]] – The [[Hinduism|Hindu]] [[Monasticism|monastic order]] '''[[Ramakrishna Mission|Sri Ramakrishna Math and Mission]]''' was founded by [[Swami Vivekananda]]. {{*mp}} [[1947]] – Italian separatist [[Salvatore Giuliano]] and his gang '''[[Portella della Ginestra massacre|fired into a crowd]]''' of [[May Day]] marchers near [[Piana degli Albanesi]], [[Sicily]], killing 11 and wounding 33. {{*mp}} [[1956]] – A doctor in Japan reported an "[[epidemic]] of an unknown disease of the [[central nervous system]]", marking the official discovery of '''[[Minamata disease]]'''. </ul> {{SelAnnivFooter|Month=May|Day=1}}<noinclude> </noinclude>
